parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: The client token that is used to ensure the idempotence of the request. You can use the client to generate the token, but you must make sure that the token is unique among different requests. **The token can contain only ASCII characters and cannot exceed 64 characters in length.** For more information, see [How to ensure idempotence](~~25693~~).

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description:
The description of the security group. The description must be 2 to 256 characters in length. It cannot start with `http://` or `https://`.

By default, this parameter is left empty.

parameters.name: RegionId
parameters.description: The region ID of the security group. You can call the [DescribeRegions](~~25609~~) operation to query the most recent region list.

parameters.name: ResourceGroupId
parameters.description: The ID of the resource group to which the security group belongs.

parameters.name: SecurityGroupName
parameters.description:
The name of the security group.

The name must be 2 to 128 characters in length. It must start with a letter but cannot start with `http://` or `https://`. It can contain letters, digits, colons (:), underscores (\_), and hyphens (-). Default value: null.

parameters.name: SecurityGroupType
parameters.description:
The type of the security group. Valid values:

*   normal: basic security group.
*   enterprise: advanced security group. For more information, see [Advanced security groups](~~120621~~).

parameters.name: ServiceManaged
parameters.description: This parameter is not publicly available.

parameters.name: Tag
parameters.description: The tags that you want to add to the security group.

parameters.name: VpcId
parameters.description:
The ID of the VPC in which you want to create the security group.

> The VpcId parameter is required only if you want to create security groups of the VPC type. In regions that support the classic network, you can create security groups of the classic network type without the need to specify the VpcId parameter.
